articles.description: At least 32 people have died after two trains collided in northern Greece, emergency services say.

articles.title: LA agrees to pay Kobe Bryant widow almost $29m
articles.description: Vanessa Bryant said first responders took photos of her late husband's remains for "morbid gossip".

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Chicago Mayor Lori Lightfoot loses re-election bid
articles.description: She was the first black woman and the first openly gay person to serve as head of America's third-largest city.
articles.content: The Democrat conceded defeat on Tuesday to two challengers, both Democrats, who will advance to a 4 April run-off vote.

articles.title: Bola Tinubu wins Nigeria's presidential election against Atiku Abubakar and Peter Obi
articles.description: Bola Tinubu, 70, is declared the winner of Nigeria's election despite opposition calls for a rerun.
articles.content:
Ruling party candidate Bola Tinubu has been declared the winner of Nigeria's disputed presidential election.
The 70-year-old veteran politician got 36% of the vote, official results show.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: FBI director Christopher Wray says Covid origin 'most likely' from Chinese lab
articles.description: Christopher Wray says the FBI has "for quite some time" settled on a potential lab incident in Wuhan.
articles.content: "The FBI has for quite some time now assessed that the origins of the pandemic are most likely a potential lab incident," he told Fox News.

articles.description: The FBI and other agencies failed to act on "potential violence planned for that day", the report finds.
articles.content:
